subject: Re: [junit] Failure Message
msgSnippet: My personal offer is that you can take part in the JUnitX project. We can then pipe the changes back to JUnit through a selected person with a peer reviewer to
messageBody:
My personal offer is that you can take part in the JUnitX
project. We can then pipe the changes back to JUnit through
a selected person with a peer reviewer to ensure the architectural
design is kept.

I tried to sign up for the JUnit-project on Sourceforge, but I
still have no reply from Kent Beck. So I do not know what is
planned with the Sourceforge project.

Perhaps it is possible to run a development version of JUnit
later where people can play around. Later the best changes
can make it into the stable version.

If you are interested, just hack JUnitX and I upload the stuff
fast. If enough people are interested I move the stuff to
SourgeForge too. I did not do that already since I want to come
back to a single JUnit project. There is no using in continuing
the split(s) for a long time.

Regards,

Andreas.


Robert Sartin wrote:
>
> --- Robert Sartin <sartin@...> wrote:
> >Patch for that (against junit 3.4):
>
> So this begs the question:
>
> How can I submit suggested patches to junit? The junit.sourceforge.net
> site isn't really up as a CVS repository.
>
> How can I help?
>
> Regards,
>
> Rob
